item.title: The McKinney Student Writing Contest Is Now Open!
item.description: The 2025 McKinney Writing Contest is open, and both undergraduate and graduate students are invited to submit entries in a wide range of categories to win cash prizes! Entries are due by midnight on March 11, 2025. Please see the McKinney Writing Contest page for more information, or email the contest committee if you have questions.

item.title: Off-Campus Housing and Resource Fair Scheduled for February 12
item.description: Date: Wednesday, February 12, 2025 2:00 PM - 5:00 PM - If you’re looking for an apartment next year, stop by and meet with representatives of local rental properties to discuss the many housing options available near campus!

item.title: Join the CCPD for Career Fair Info Sessions on February 11
item.description: From 5pm to 8pm on Tuesday, February 11, students are invited to attend 45-minute info sessions with select career fair employers in the Union before the fair! Please see the CCPD Spring 2025 Career Fair Info Sessions collection in Handshake for more info; please note that space is limited, and all sessions are on a first-come, first-served basis.

item.title: RPI and Hokkaido University Joint seminar - February 13
item.description: Thursday, February 13, 2025 6:30 PM - 7:30 PM - Joint seminar series between RPI and Hokkaido University highlights advanced semiconductor and related technologies for future communication and computing. In this joint seminar, Prof. Hiromichi Ohta will talk about “Solid-State Electrochemical Thermal Transistors” and Prof. Trevor David Rhone will talk about “Accelerating the Design and Discovery of Quantum Materials.

item.title: IBM Quantum Support: On-campus Office Hours February 13
item.description: IBM quantum support will be holding open on-campus office hours Thursday, February 13th from 9am to 11am ET in CII 3159. During this time, IBM personnel will be available to answer questions regarding your specific applications about quantum computing, quantum algorithms, and other quantum computer questions you may have. For additional information about RPI Quantum Computing, please visit https://quantum.rpi.edu

item.title: Chemistry Seminar Series Continues February 11
item.description: Tuesday, February 11, 2025 4:00 PM - 5:00 PM - This seminar features Lane Baker, Professor of Chemistry at Texas A&M University, who will speak on “Expanding the Electrochemical Toolbox: A Story in Two Parts”. All are invited.
item.author: Community

item.title: SOLD OUT - Ghost Images: Korakrit Arunanondchai - February 11
item.description: Tuesday, February 11, 2025 7:00 PM - All are invited to this FREE work-in-progress event! Step into an immersive environment where cinematic gestures flicker on clouds of fog, figures emerge from shadows, and images drift between clarity and abstraction. Exploring themes of ritual, possession, and memory, artist-in-residence Korakrit Arunanondchai blends elemental forces with an evocative sound score to conjure chimeric forms—ghosts of history, technology, and self.⁣⁣

item.title: DotCIO - Tech Tip Tuesday - Why is it important to regularly back up your Data!
item.description: Hardware fails and when it does that is not the time to realize you have not backed up your data. It is crucial to back up important data from your desktops, laptops, tablets, even smartphones.

item.title: Cognitive Science Colloquium Scheduled for February 12th
item.description: Please join the Cognitive Science Department at noon on 2/12 for a presentation titled “HARMONIC: Cognitive and Control Collaboration in Human-Robotic Teams” by Dr. Sanjay Oruganti, Research Scientist in the Language-Endowed Intelligent Agents (LEIA) Lab at RPI’s Cognitive Science Department (Carnegie 113).

item.title: Mercer X February Clubhouse Workshops and Seminars
item.description: Mercer X Affiliated Clubs are offering workshops for any RPI student in February! Upcoming workshops include: Introduction to Siemens NX CAD Workshop (2/15), Soldering and HF Antenna Build (2/19), and Data Structure Review Session (2/26). Microelectronics Packaging Seminars are every Thursday. All are held in JEC 6203/6204 and hosted by the Rensselaer Spaceflight Society, Embedded Hardware Club, W2SZ Radio Club, Girls Who Code, and IEEE EPS! Contact sawyes@rpi.edu to receive more information.

item.title: Quick Learn Webinar - Creating Basic Pivot Tables with Excel for Windows
item.description:
Date: Monday, February 24, 2025 1:30 PM - 2:00 PM - Do you work with data in Excel? Are you always manipulating the content with filters and sorting? If so, taking a look at Pivot Tables in Excel could be beneficial. Maureen Fodera (Office of Undergraduate Education) will focus on using Pivot Tables in Excel to summarize, filter and group data. Basic functions will be applied as well as a quick look at charts. Register here for the webinar.
